game.title: Smash TV
game.gameDescription: A hyper-violent, fast-paced arcade twin-stick shooter set within a futuristic bloodsport game show where contestants fight waves of enemies for prizes and their lives.

vision.description: Create a high-adrenaline, quarter-eating arcade experience that satirizes consumerism and reality TV violence.
vision.designGoals: Maximum screen saturation, overwhelming odds, and visceral 'over-the-top' rewards.
vision.playerFantasy: The gladiator of the future; a contestant seeking fame and fortune through lethal combat.
vision.targetExperience: Frantic, stressful, and rewarding; a sense of being constantly outnumbered but heavily armed.
vision.successMetrics: High player throughput (arcade quarters), long-term high score chasing, and player satisfaction through 'total carnage'.

targetAudience.description: Hardcore arcade gamers and fans of action-oriented shooters.
targetAudience.playerTypes: Achievers (High Scores), Killers (Combat focused), Social (Co-op play).
targetAudience.skillLevel: High; requires excellent spatial awareness and twitch reflexes.
targetAudience.ageRatingTarget: Teen/Mature (due to pixelated gore and violence).

platformConstraints.description: Designed for dedicated arcade cabinets with unique control layouts.
platformConstraints.inputDevices: Dual 8-way joysticks (one for movement, one for firing).
platformConstraints.sessionLengthMinutes: 3 to 15 minutes depending on player skill.

setting.description: A dystopian future where the most popular TV show involves mass slaughter.
setting.settingDescription: The 'Smash TV' studio, a series of interconnected arena rooms filled with traps, enemies, and luxury prizes.

narrative.description: Minimalist story delivered through the game's announcer and environment.
narrative.narrativePremise: Contestants enter a lethal game show to win toasters, VCRs, and cold hard cash.
narrative.conflict: The Contestant vs. the Show Host and his endless legion of mutants and robots.
narrative.storytellingMethod: Environmental cues and iconic digitized voice lines (e.g., 'Big Money! Big Prizes! I love it!').
narrative.endingPhilosophy: The 'Pleasure Dome'â€”a secret final reward for the most skilled players.

player.description: A highly mobile soldier capable of 360-degree firing.

lives.description: The player has a limited pool of attempts to clear the show.

player.movement: 8-way directional movement at a fixed speed.

controls.movement: Left Joystick controls the character's position.
controls.shooting: Right Joystick controls the direction of the stream of bullets.

systems.description: Interlocking systems of projectile management and crowd control.

combatSystem.description: Projectile-based combat against melee and ranged swarms.
combatSystem.designIntentOfCombat: Overwhelm the player, forcing them to prioritize high-threat targets.
combatSystem.damageModel: Instant death on contact with enemies or projectiles.
combatSystem.fireRate: High default; increased with power-ups like the 'Spewer'.
combatSystem.weaponReload: None; weapons are based on time-limited power-ups.

movementSystem.description: Evasive maneuvering within a confined rectangular arena.
movementSystem.designIntent: Provide enough agility to weave through 'bullet hell' and swarming mobs.
movementSystem.precisionRequirement: High; pixel-perfect dodging is often required.
movementSystem.momentum: Instant; zero inertia for maximum responsiveness.

enemyAI.designIntentOfEnemyBehavior: To flush the player out of corners and force constant movement.

enemies.description: Diverse types ranging from fodder to mechanical behemoths.
enemies.enemyType: Grunts, Club Men, Tank Bots, Shrapnel Bombs, Bosses (e.g., Mutoid Man).
enemies.enemyBehavior: Swarming, exploding on death, or firing multi-directional beams.
enemies.enemyThreatLevel: Variable; Grunts are low, Wall Turrets and Bosses are High.

civilianCharacters.description: Non-combatants/Hosts present in the game world.
civilianCharacters.canCiviliansBeKilledByEnemies: Not applicable (Civilians usually appear as prizes/escorts).
civilianCharacters.rescueBonusPoints: Points awarded for collecting 'Beautiful Assistants' or Hostages.

lootSystem.description: Non-functional items collected for score and thematic flavor.
lootSystem.collectionFeedback: Floating text showing point value and item name over the player.

mechanics.coreLoop: Enter Room -> Kill Enemies -> Collect Prizes/Power-ups -> Choose Next Room Exit.

navigation.description: Non-linear progression through the studio wings.
navigation.exitMethod: Directional doors (North, South, East, West) open upon clearing all enemies in a room.

powerUps.description: Temporary weapon enhancements that replace the standard gun.

powerUpsTypes.powerUpsEffect: Circular saw-blades that orbit the player
Lobbed explosives with high splash damage

powerUps.powerUpsDurationLogic: Power-ups are on a hidden timer and expire automatically.

enemySpawning.description: Enemies emerge from four distinct doors in the arena corners.
enemySpawning.spawnType: Infinite wave-based spawning until the room's quota is met.
enemySpawning.spawnScalingFactors: Room number, studio wing (difficulty level), and player score.

difficulty.difficultyScalingModel: Static increase per room; global difficulty setting via arcade dip switches.
difficulty.noDifficultySelection: Standard arcade; no manual difficulty selection for players.

failureState.description: Conditions that end a play session.
failureState.failureResult: Game Over; prompt to Insert Coin to continue.

difficultyDesign.description: Philosophy and structure behind difficulty progression.
difficultyDesign.playerCatchUpMechanics: Power-up crates spawn immediately upon player respawn.
difficultyDesign.difficultyCaps: The final studio (The Pleasure Dome) represents the maximum possible difficulty.

ui.description: User interface elements and feedback systems.

VisualAndAudioFeedback.description: Visual and audio responses to player actions.
VisualAndAudioFeedback.visual: Digitized gore explosions, screen shakes, and flashing 'Prize' indicators.
VisualAndAudioFeedback.audio: High-fidelity digitized speech and industrial synth tracks.

artDirection.description: Visual design rules and aesthetic principles.
artDirection.readabilityRules: Enemies and projectiles use bright, high-contrast palettes against darker arena floors.
artDirection.animationPrinciples: Exaggerated death animations for enemies (shrapnel and gore).

announcerSystem.announcerRole: The Show Host acts as the voice of the game's dark humor.

keyTriggersOfTheAnnouncer.onLargePrize: Big Money! Big Prizes! I love it!
keyTriggersOfTheAnnouncer.onPowerUp: I'd buy that for a dollar!

audioDesign.soundDesignRules: Layered explosion sounds to emphasize power.

accessibility.accessibilityRationale: Standard coin-op design focused on mechanical mastery.

replayability.secondaryDrivers: Unlocking the 'Pleasure Dome' and discovering hidden room paths.

gameFlow.description: High-level state machine of the game.
gameFlow.gameFlowStates: Intro/Attract -> Coin Insert -> Studio 1 -> Studio 2 -> Studio 3 -> The Pleasure Dome -> Ending/Credits.

technicalNotes.determinism: High; room sequences and spawn counts are programmed.
technicalNotes.knownTechnicalRisks: Hardware limitations on the number of active sprites before flickering occurs.
